contentheadline.headline: Queen's Own Warwickshire and Worcestershire Yeomanry

contentrichtext.text: {{ref improve|date=March 2013}} '''The Queens Own Warwickshire & Worcestershire Yeomanry''' was a regiment of the [[Territorial Army (United Kingdom)|Territorial Army]], formed in 1956 by the amalgamation of [[The Warwickshire Yeomanry]] and [[The Queen's Own Worcestershire Hussars]], and split up in 1971. The regiment was re-roled as infantry in 1967, with three [[Squadron (army)|squadron]]s, of which one was formed from a company of 7th Battalion, [[The Royal Warwickshire Fusiliers]]. In 1969 it was reduced to a cadre, and in 1971 split into two squadrons; one formed '''67 (Queen's Own Warwickshire and Worcestershire Yeomanry) Signal Squadron''' of [[37 Signal Regiment|37th (Wessex and Welsh) Signal Regiment, Royal Signals]], whilst the other became '''A (Warwickshire and Worcestershire) Squadron''' of the [[Mercian Yeomanry]]. In 1992 this squadron transferred to the [[Royal Mercian and Lancastrian Yeomanry]], and in 1999 amalgamated with B Squadron to form '''A (Shropshire, Warwickshire and Worcestershire) Squadron''', [[Royal Mercian and Lancastrian Yeomanry]].<ref name="regiments.org">[http://www.regiments.org/regiments/uk/volmil-england/vcav/warwick.htm The Queen's Own Warwickshire and Worcestershire Yeomanry]{{dead link|date=March 2013}}, regiments.org</ref> ==External links== * [http://www.qowwy.org.uk/ Queen's Own Warwickshire & Worcestershire Yeomanry Comrades Association] - Website dedicated to past and present serving members of the Warwickshire Yeomanry, Queen's Own Worcestershire Hussars, and all successor units. ==References== <references/> [[Category:Yeomanry regiments of the British Army]] [[Category:Military units and formations established in 1956]] [[Category:1956 establishments in the United Kingdom]]
